roleset.note: CONSPIRE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'conspired' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry. Comparison with 'work'.True etymological tidbit: "conspire" comes from the Latin for "tobreathe together", since conspirators inevitably huddle together whenhatching their nefarious plans. Actually, I just really like the word "nefarious." (from conspire.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: conspirators merged
example.text: The company is the subject of a federal grand jury investigation into whether its officials and its utility subsidiaries conspired to cover up their accounting for spare parts to evade federal income taxes.

example.name: conspirators separated
example.text: The central charge against Judge Hastings is that he conspired with a Washington lawer to obtain a $150,000 bribe from defendants in a criminal case before the judge, in return for leniency.
example.arg: to obtain a $150,000 bribe from defendants in a criminal case before the judge, in return for leniency
